New Records: Anthony Volpe hit a go-ahead grand slam in the third inning, marking his first career World Series grand slam.
The New York Yankees scored 11 runs, the most in a World Series game since 1978.
Freddie Freeman extended his World Series home run streak to six games, the first player to do so.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam in the third inning was a turning point.
Gleyber Torres hit a three-run homer in the eighth inning.
Aaron Judge recorded his first RBI of the World Series with a single in the eighth.
Tim Mayza closed out the Dodgers in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers used a bullpen game for the fourth time in the 2024 postseason.
The Yankees' starting lineup included Jazz Chisholm Jr. and Austin Wells.
A fan interfered with Mookie Betts' catch, leading to an out call.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Volpe expressed pride in his performance and the team's comeback.
Aaron Judge acknowledged the offensive outburst and the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ashanti performed the national anthem before the game.
The game was played under partly cloudy conditions with a wind.
The Yankees avoided being swept despite a 3-0 series deficit.
Others: The Dodgers' bullpen performed effectively, retiring the Yankees in order in several innings.
